channel.title: BBC News - Wales
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Hot weather: Welsh outlets shut due to 'unbearable' temperatures
item.description: A seaside resort restaurant and a village pub temporarily close in the extreme heat warning.

item.title: Heatwave: People 'walking into A&E with life-threatening conditions'
item.description: One hospital boss says people with life-threatening conditions are walking into A&E.

item.title: Cardiff man jumped from car after argument, inquest told
item.description: James Davies argued with his girlfriend before his death, a coroner's court hears.

item.title: Cardiff: Bute Park attack leaves man with life-threatening injuries
item.description: "To subject another person to violence in this way is intolerable," says senior police officer.

item.title: Part of M4 near Cardiff shut after lorry crash
item.description: One person is taken to hospital after a motorway crash in Cardiff.

item.title: Mayhill: Claim authorities 'knew of stolen car danger before riot'
item.description: Local resident says he warned that stolen cars were being freewheeled down hill months before riot.

item.title: Man admits manslaughter of David Jones in Holyhead
item.description: David Jones died in hospital after he was assaulted on Anglesey in November.

item.title: Covid in Wales: Three deaths registered in latest week
item.description: Deaths from all causes were 15% above normal levels but those involving Covid remained the same.

item.title: Rape: Handling of cases must change, says Wales' CPS boss
item.description: Wales' new chief crown prosecutor says work has started to improve the experience for victims.

item.title: Tory MP Rob Roberts recall petition move wrong, says watchdog
item.description: The MPs complaints watchdog says it is "seriously concerned" about the move.

item.title: Farming in Wales: Deaths on farms more than double in a year
item.description: The Health and Safety Executive says its recent report was 'disappointing' and 'unacceptable'.

item.title: Covid in Wales: NHS pay petition gathers almost 800,000 names
item.description: Staff hailed as "heroes" during the pandemic deserve to be rewarded, says nurse who set up petition.

item.title: Barry cricket death: 'My friend was literally just dying there'
item.description: Tributes to 44-year-old father-of-three who died playing for his local cricket club.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Duke of Cambridge meets Team GB boxer and medal hopeful Lauren Price
item.description: The Duke of Cambridge meets Team GB boxer and medal hopeful Lauren Price at Kensington Palace.

item.title: Rescuers find lost dog Ollie after swim off Porthcawl
item.description: Ollie was found by the RNLI three miles away from where he jumped into the sea for a swim.

item.title: Covid: Pontypool shoppers want to 'revive' town centre
item.description: Once a major city centre, Pontypool town like many other places has seen shops close due to Covid.

item.title: Amputee's win for prosthetics funding in Wales shows 'people power'
item.description: David Bradley said amputees in Wales had been disadvantaged compared to the rest of the UK.

item.title: Covid: Why rinks opening in Wales is on ice
item.description: Although ice rinks can re-open from Saturday, Ice Arena Wales will be ready from 1 August.

item.title: Siya Kolisi: South Africa captain to start against British and Irish Lions
item.description: South Africa captain Siya Kolisi recovers from Covid-19 to be named in the starting XV to face the British and Irish Lions in the first Test on Saturday.

item.title: Jade Jones: The making of double Olympic champion chasing history in Tokyo
item.description: BBC Sport Wales tells the inside story of how a girl from Flint became a double Olympic champion on the brink of more history in Tokyo.

item.title: South Africa v British and Irish Lions: All three Tests set for Cape Town
item.description: All three Tests between South Africa and the British and Irish Lions will now be staged in Cape Town because of the Covid-19 pandemic.

item.title: Wayne Hennessey: Burnley sign Wales goalkeeper on two-year deal
item.description: Burnley sign Wales goalkeeper Wayne Hennessey on a two-year contract after his Crystal Palace exit.

item.title: Olivia Breen: World champion para-athlete left angry after official said her shorts were 'too revealing'
item.description: Double world champion para-athlete Olivia Breen said she was left angry and speechless after being told to wear 'more appropriate' shorts.

item.title: 'Gwres yn cynyddu'r straen' ar wasanaethau iechyd
item.description: Mae rheolwyr yn apelio ar bobl i osgoi rhoi mwy o bwysau ar y gwasanaeth ambiwlans ac adrannau brys.

item.title: Pryder am effaith 'ddinistriol' gwersylla gwyllt ar natur
item.description: Mae gwersylla gwyllt yn peryglu ecosystemau bregus Cymru, yn ôl yr Ymddiriedolaeth Genedlaethol.

item.title: Anafiadau difrifol wedi ymosodiad ym Mharc Bute, Caerdydd
item.description: Cyngor Caerdydd yn ailddechrau cloi mynedfeydd i'r parc yn sgil dau ddigwyddiad "difrifol iawn".

item.title: Gareth Bonello yn plethu lleisiau Cymru ac India
item.description: Khasi-Cymru Collective yw prosiect newydd y cerddor, sy'n cynnwys artistiaid o India

item.title: Prif hyfforddwyr yn gadael tîm rygbi Merched Cymru
item.description: Warren Abrahams yn gadael ei swydd lai na naw mis ar ôl cael ei benodi.
